reviews.review: i loved the movie it was great but it felt rushed at some points if it was more than three hours it would have more time for the characters interactions between them and with the settings but that could be the fault of the cinemas that wanted the movie short but still
In my opinion the best Marvel movie by far!

If your looking for a lot of answers to civil war you wont find them all in this movie. The most youll get is learning where characters end up after civil war. However, the movie does a great job answering questions about unknowns in the MCU like the infinity stones and thanos. The movie is filled with almost non stop action and because theres so many characters you dont get a lot of character interaction that you were probably hoping for, but does a good job of developing some characters further in this movie. The ending is an absolute cliffhanger and makes you ready to see avengers 4 immediately after and wondering how earths mightiest heroes will deal with the repurcussions of this film. Overall this film is action packed and a thriller all the way through that will blow your mind and make you crave the next movie even more than this one. Also, thanos character is beautifully played in the movie and honestly has become my favorite villain of any movie ever. Cant wait to see him again.

Avengers Infinity War absolutely works!! This has got to be the best audience movie ever made while also not giving anyone any reason to moan, because all you can do is cheer, weep and be in shock after what you just witnessed.

When I left the theatre, I couldn't have been more satisfied with the movie. Everything wanted was there and probably more. There were a few cringe moments and potential plotholes, but overall, the acting was good, the movie tied its legion of characters together well, and the plot was intriguing. Would suggest.

This one was tough to watch. But amazing. It really stuck with me 24 hours after watching. The last Marvel movie that happened to was Winter Soldier, still my favorite until IW. The story was surprising, the smaller groups was well put together. The larger battle was exciting and kept you on the edge of your seat. 

From the opening scene, you knew any character could die at any time. It kept you uneasy and knew the stakes were high. 

Thanos is imposing not only physically, he is mentally superior. He does have a purpose, no matter how twisted it is, it makes sense. Those are the best villains. The ones who think they are morally correct. Props to Josh Brolin and the Cagi magicians behind creating this character. He was very believable. 

RDJ always is great, but Chris Hemmsworth stood out as his redefined Thor. He really was a lot of fun and again proved his might. His new weapon is no Mjolnor but I like it. I am mad at Star Lord, but I get it, sort of. Spidey and Dr. Strange are fantastic too. I may have started crushing again on Scarlet Johansson.
Great movie! Thanks is an excellent villain with a motivation that's appropriate for today. I'm so glad that they're doing this in 2 parts! It gives the story time to unfold!
Amazing! The culmination of 18 movies and 10 years, Marvel once again delivers the goods and continues to churn out hit after hit. Avengers 4 can't come soon enough
At least 50% of the superheroes dead or erased by the end of the movie. The Matrix: Revolutions was more heartwarming.
